0325.caption: Man looking into a telescope at Saturn, saying 'That's a big-ass moon.'
0325.title: Christiaan Huygens discovers the largest moon of Saturn, Titan

0326.caption: A car driving down the road with two people. One person says, 'You are really bad at this and we never should have allowed it.'
0326.title: The UK introduces a driving test.

0327.caption: Yoda and Chewbacca standing on the sidewalk above Billy Dee Williams's star. Yoda says, 'Billy Dee Williams, who the hell is?' Chewbacca grunts in response.
0327.title: Billy Dee Williams receives a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.

0328.caption: The king stands holding a red dress on a coat hanger and says, 'Okay, I got it, but I don't get it.'
0328.title: The Parliament asks King George II to seek redress from Spain, kicking off the War of Jenkins' Ear.

0329.caption: The queen stands and says, 'I think those Yanks need a nice hat. Make it so.'
0329.title: Queen Victoria gives royal assent to the British North American Act, which created Canada.

0329.caption: A man stands with wide eyes holding a bottle of Coca-Cola and says, 'Cocaine mixed with water is AMAZING.'
0329.title: John Pemberton brews the first batch of Coca-Cola in Atlanta.

0329.caption: A man standing in front of the US Capitol building with an 'I voted' sticker says, 'We're still not represented in Congress, though.'
0329.title: The 23rd Amendment is ratified, giving residents of Washington, DC, a vote in Presidential elections.

0330.caption: A sheep and a man standing in a field. The sheep says 'baaah' but is cut off by the man saying, 'You shut up you little shit.'
0330.title: The Silence of the Lambs wins the Oscar for Best Picture.

0331.caption: A man adjusts a clock and says, 'Time to spring forward!' A piranha creeper from Mario looks at the man and says, 'Say sike right now.'
0331.title: Daylight Savings Time goes into effect in the United States for the first time.

0401.caption: Two men look at a chalkboard showing the formation of the universe. One says, 'So the whole universe is really just debris?' The other says, 'It WOULD explain a lot.'
0401.title: A paper describing how the elements came into being after the Big Bang is published by Alpher, Gamow, and Bethe.

0402.caption: The computer HAL 9000 is speaking: 'Look Dave, I can see you're really upset about this. I honestly think you ought to sit down calmly, take a stress pill, and think things over. If you could see the next 19 years, you might not mind the lack of oxygen right now.
0402.title: 2001: A Space Odyssey premiers

0403.caption: A king stands with arms raised in victory and says, 'HA! I took the cookies, I left the seat up, I farted in the car, and now there's nothing you can do about it!'
0403.title: Edward the Confessor is crowned King of England

0404.caption: A man stands at a lectern and says, 'We should ban chemical weapons. Chemicals are very bad and we must completely stop using them to make weapons!' An aside reads, '...and peace reigned...'
0404.title: Ronald Reagan calls for a ban on chemical weapons

0405.caption: Two Pilgrims stand on shore walking towards a boat. One says, 'Let's get the hell out of here.' The other responds, 'Yeah, this place is bananas.'
0405.title: The Mayflower departs from Plymouth, Massachusetts, on a return voyage to England.

0406.caption: A tiger stands to the side and exclaims, 'You're grrrrrrreat!'
0406.title: The first Tony Awards

0407.caption: Two people stand before a judge. The American is holding a bunch of bananas and says, 'This shit is bananas! B A N A N A S!' The European responds, 'No it isn't, you cheerleader.' The judge sighs and says, 'Yeah, those are very clearly bananas.
0407.title: The World Trade Organization ends the long-running dispute between the United States and the European Union about bananas, ruling in favor of the US.

0408.caption: A female admiral stands at a table of other people and says, 'Yes, everyone will make fun of it, but we must make it good because these doofuses will be using whatever we make for at least 60 years.
0408.title: Grace Hopper and her team meet for the first time to begin creating what will eventually become COBOL.

0409.caption: The US state of Georgia says, 'I denounce the Soviet Union and declare my independence!' The US state of Alabama responds, 'Dude, what the hell?'
0409.title: Georgia declares independence from the Soviet Union.

0410.caption: Four people are in a Volkswagen Beetle. One man stands outside waving and says, 'Sorry boys, it was just too cramped in there.'
0410.title: Paul McCartney announces he is leaving the Beatles.

0411.caption: A general stands speaking and says, 'Old soldiers never die, just fade aw– no! Wait! Not literally!' as his body fades away
0411.title: General Douglas MacArthur is relieved of command in Korea by President Harry Truman

0412.caption: A jukebox plays 'Rock Around the Clock' while Fonzie says 'eeeyyyyyy'
0412.title: Billy Haley and the Comets record 'Rock Around the Clock'

0413.caption: A choir sings on stage. A man in the audience stands with raised fist and says, 'You havent said Messiah a single time!
0413.title: First performance of Handel's Messiah

0414.caption: Soldiers behind a pillow fort hold pillows above their head while soldiers on the other side charge with pillows.
0414.title: US Civil War battle of Fort Pillow, Tennessee

0415.caption: Jackie Robinson stands holding a baseball bat, wearing a Brooklyn Dodgers uniform with number 47.
0415.title: Jackie Robinson debuts for the Brooklyn Dodgers, the first African-American allowed to play in US major league baseball.

0416.caption: A bat-winged man with boxing gloves faces an oversided revolver for a fight.
0416.title: In Dodge City, Kansas, Bat Masterson has his final gunfight.

0417.caption: A person is chased by a lion. They say, 'Why did we pick a lion?'
0417.title: The Metro, Goldwyn, and Mayer film studios merge to create MGM.

0418.caption: A person reclines in a chair and says, 'Best. Day. Ever.'
0418.title: BBC Radio news announces 'there is no news' and broadcasts music instead.

0419.caption: A man seeing waves of colors says, 'The snozzberries taste like snozzberries!'
0419.title: Albert Hoffman deliberately doses himself with LSD for the first time.

0420.caption: A red German Fokker Dr.1 triplane flies across the page.
0420.title: Manfred von Richtofen shoots down two enemies, getting his 79th and 80th victories.

0421.caption: Snoopy is dressed in old-timey pilot gear, sitting on top of his doghouse. He says 'got im'
0421.title: Baron von Richtofen, better known as the Red Baron, is shot down for the last time

0422.caption: A person pointing at a calendar labeled April 22 says, 'And this is the day it all went to shit.'
0422.title: NCSA Mosaic web browser version 1.0 released, bringing the modern web to life

0423.caption: Wrigley Field
0423.title: First game at Wrigley Field, then known as Weegham Park

0424.caption: A queen and a dolphin stand in front of the Notre Dame cathedral in Paris. The queen thinks, 'He doesnt look anything like his profile pic...'
0424.title: Mary, Queen of Scots, marries the Dauphin of France at Notre Dame de Paris

0425.caption: A DNA double helix
0425.title: The structure of DNA as a double-helix is reported in the journal Nature in three simultaneous papers by Watson and Crick (describing a physical model of DNA), and Wilkins and Franklin (describing the data that underpinned the physical model).

0426.caption: A Chicago Cubs baseball player throws a ball
0426.title: Cubs outfielder Jack McCarthy becomes the first major league player to throw out three runners at home plate in a single game

0427.caption: A mouse is sitting at a computer, typing commands
0427.title: Xerox PARC introduces the computer mouse

0428.caption: A baby wearing a cowboy hat and holster is crawling away from a crib
0428.title: Billy the Kid escapes from jail

0429.caption: A woman in armor stands outside a castle, looking out towards enemy soldiers and says, 'What if, instead of saving this old Orleans, we just built a new one?'
0429.title: Joan of Arc arrives to lift the siege of Orleans in the Hundred Years War

0430.caption: A king is throwing an orange toilet screaming, 'KING OF THROWING TOILETS!'
0430.title: Willem-Alexander is inaugurated King of the Netherlands after the abdication of Beatrix

0501.caption: People gathered around a table, Scottish flags on one side, English on the other. Two people sit at the table signing papers. One Scottish person says, 'We're really going to regret this in 300 years or so...'
0501.title: The Acts of Union joining the Kingdoms of England and Scotland into the Kingdom of Great Britain takes effect.

0502.caption: A man looks into a telescope at a pair of stars encircled with 001100010010011110100001101101110011 and says, '...0011?' Behind him, a paradox-correcting timesphere opens with a robotic leg sticking out.
0502.title: Xi Ursae Majoris, the first binary star discovered, is spotted by William Herschel.

0503.caption: A person is looking at a TV and says 'Why do people like this so much?' On the TV is a derby hat with the Kentucky flag waving in the background.
0503.title: The Kentucky Derby is televised nationally for the first time.

0504.caption: A bottle of bourbon wearing a crown says, 'Down with wine! Hail to the king, baby!'
0504.title: The Bourbon Restoration begins in France with the exile of Napoleon and the new reign of Louis XVIII.

0505.caption: An angry monkey gestures wildly, wearing a golden cross and a sash saying 'William Jennings Bryan.' A person standing next to it says, 'I mean sure, not EVERYONE has evolved, but still...'
0505.title: John T. Scopes is arrested for teaching evolution in violation of Tennessee law.

0506.caption: A new bridge spanning a canyon and river
0506.title: The Works Progress Administration is created by President Roosevelt's executive order 7034.

0507.caption: Two lions arue at a table
0507.title: The Second Council of Lyon begins in France to set rules for the election of the Pope

0508.caption: A man offering bottles of Coca-Cola on a table. A sign reads 'Cocaine Water 5¢.' The man says, 'This is some good shit first sip is free.'
0508.title: John Pemberton sells Coca-Cola as a patent medicne for the first time

0509.caption: A very long horse that is also a bus with some people in it
0509.title: The first horsebus is debuted in Mumbai, India

0510.caption: A woman stands in front of a lectern and says, 'What if we treated everyone with respect, gave equal pay, and stopped calling everyone 'guys'?
0510.title: Victoria Woodhull becomes the first woman to run for President of the United States nominated by the Equal Rights Party.

0511.caption: The people stand in front of the Minnesota flag. The first says, 'Oh hey, we're a state now dontcha know.' The second responds, 'Oh you dont say!' The first person says, 'Oh yeah, it's true, you betcha!' The second person replies, 'Oh for fun!'
0511.title: Minnesota becomes the thirty-second state of the United States

0512.caption: A prairie on a green screen with a wagon and ox in front. A banner beneath the wagon reads, 'You were eaten by your children.'
0512.title: The Donner Party departs Independence, Missouri, on a journey to California.

0513.caption: Reggie Jackson stands at home plate as a pitch goes past. The umpire yells 'Strike three!' Reggie Jackson thinks, 'Yes! A record!'
0513.title: Reggie Jackson becomes the first person in Major League Baseball to strike out 2,000 times.

0514.caption: A man in a brown hat swings by on a whip. In movie font reads: 'Virginia Smith and the First Crusade'
0514.title: The First Crusade begins in earnest with the Siege of Nicaea

0515.caption: A Disney 'mouse ears' logo with red eyes and the words 'OMNIA MEA'
0515.title: Mickey Mouse debuts in his first cartoon, Plane Crazy

0516.caption: Two people are standing. One is holding four pennies and says, 'Man, carrying around more than 4 pennies really sucks.' The other looks thoughtfully and says, 'There must be a better way...'
0516.title: The nickel coin is established by an act of the US Congress

0517.caption: Four wealthy people at an expensive banquet raise gold goblets and declare, 'Fuck the poor!'
0517.title: The New York Stock Exchange is founded

0517.caption: A judge bangs a gavel and declares loudly, 'SEPARATE IS INHERENTLY UNEQUAL.'
0517.title: The US Supreme Court unaminously decides that segregation of schools on the basis of race is unconstitutional

0518.caption: Abraham Lincoln stands triumphantly in front of red white and blue bunting
0518.title: At the Republican National Convention, Abraham Lincoln is nominted for President on the third ballot

0519.caption: Two people are standing. One is holding a candle and says, 'What a day, huh?' The other says, 'Lemon, its noon.'
0519.title: Around mid-day, the sky over New England and parts of Canada went so dark as to require candles, due to an unusual combination of clouds, thick fog, and forest fire smoke.

0520.caption: Three leaders sign a document at a table. The first wearing a German spiked helmet says, 'Friends forever!' The next wearing an Austro-Hungarian soldier's cap says, 'This is the best!' The final wearing an Italian royal cap says, 'Nothing can go wrong!'
0520.title: The Triple Alliance between the German Empire, Austria-Hungary, and the Kingdom of Italy is formed.

0520.caption: President Abraham Lincoln signs the Homestead Act (source: Library of Congress Today in History)
0520.title: Abraham Lincoln signs a document that reads, 'In case of pandemic, stay home stead of going out.'

0521.caption: The tallest roller coaster in the world, Kingda Ka, opens in New Jersey
0521.title: The Earth and moon. A roller coaster rises from behind the far horizon, nearly to the moon, and then desends back to Earth.

0522.caption: The Apollo 10 lunar module, codenamed 'Snoopy,' passes within 8.4 nautical miles of the moon's surface
0522.title: An Apollo lunar excursion module flies near the moon. A voice cries out, 'Lets just land it! They cant stop us!' An electronic voice responds, 'Snoopy, this is mission control. Do NOT land.'

0523.caption: The Second Defenestration of Prague begins the Thirty Years' War
0523.title: A person is falling from the a high window of a tower, yelling 'NOT AGAIN!'

0524.caption: British Prime Minister Theresa May announces her resignation as leader of the Conservative Party under pressure over her handling of Brexit
0524.title: Theresa May stands behind a lectern with the UK flag beside her and says, 'In recognition that I have been a great prune, I hereby announce my resignation.

0525.caption: The Gateway Arch in St. Louis is dedicated
0525.title: The Gateway arch sings, 'Never gonna give you up! Never gonna let you down! Never gonna run around and desert you!'

0526.caption: The first National Sorry Day is held in Austrlia to remember and commemorate the mistreatment of the country's indigenous peoples as part of ongoing reconciliation
0526.title: Two people stand - one representing Australia and the other Canada. Australia says, 'We are sorry for our long-time mistreatment of indigeous peoples.' Canada says, 'Dude! Apologizing is OUR thing!' Australia responds, 'Also sorry for stealing your thing.'

0527.caption: The final broadcast of the Arsenio Hall Show. Also the final broadcast of Larry King's radio show and the theatrical release of the Flintstons live-action movie.
0527.title: Arsenio Hall stands fist-bumping and saying 'Whoop! Whoop! Whoop! Whoop!'

0528.caption: Alan Turin submits for publication his paper that proves some mathematical problems cannot be solved purely by computation
0528.title: Alan Turing stands in front of a chalkboard and says, 'As you can see, computers suck.'

0529.caption: John Pemberton places the first advertisement for Coca-Cola, appearing in the Atlanta Journal.
0529.title: A wide-eyed man stands with a newspaper showing an advertisement and says, 'I HAVENT SLEPT IN TWO MONTHS THIS IS GOOD SHIT YOU GOTTA TRY IT

0530.caption: Joan of Arc is burned at the stake
0530.title: A woman stands in front of a grill with a very, very cooked steak and says, 'Whoa. That is way overdone.'

0531.caption: The President of the United States courageously turns off the lights at the White House and hides in the bunker rather than face outrage over continued police murders of Black people.
0531.title: The White House, darkened.

0601.caption: John Cor, a monk, brews the first-known batch of Scotch whiskey.
0601.title: A monk stands next to an oak barrel holding a glass of whiskey and says, 'Yes... God IS good. *hic*'

0602.caption: Queen Elizabeth II is corronated and begins her eternal reign.
0602.title: The Queen stands with arms raised and shouts, 'ITS ALL MIIIIINE!'

0603.caption: Hernando de Soto claims Florida for Spain, despite the people already living there.
0603.title: A Native man and a conquistador face each other. The Spainiard says, 'I claim this land for Spain!' The Native man just replies, 'Dude.'

0604.caption: The Chinese People's Liberation Army murders hundreds of pro-Democracy demonstrators at Tiananmen Square.
0604.title: No image today.

0605.caption: Davie Jones and the King Bees debuts 'I Cant Help Thinking About Me.' The band breaks up, but Davie Jones goes on to success as David Bowie.
0605.title: Ziggy Stardust

0606.caption: The YMCA is founded in London
0606.title: The Village People constructor worker, cowboy, sailor, and leather biker perform the YMCA dance

0607.caption: Protestors in the UK topple a statue of Atlantic slave-trader Edward Colston and throw it into the River Avon, amid continuing demonstrations against racism and police brutality.
0607.title: A group of people stand around a toppled statue with raised fists and shout, 'BLACK LIVES MATTER!'

0608.caption: The USPS and US Navy perform the first and only 'missile mail' delivery.
0608.title: A submarine launches a missile with the USPS logo on it. It sings out 'I want to fly like a missile!'

0609.caption: Joseph Welch, special counsel for the US Army, famously rebukes Senator Joseph McCarthy.
0609.title: A man leans over a table covered in papers. Another man points and shouts, 'Have you no sense of decency, sir, at long last? Have you left no sense of decency?'

0610.caption: The Spirit Rover launches on its journey to Mars, where it will conduct scientific missions for over six years.
0610.title: A rover on the surface of Mars sings, 'This was a triumph. Im making a note here, HUGE SUCCESS.

0611.caption: The Cassini-Huygens probe makes its closest flyby of Saturn's moon Phoebe.
0611.title: A probe flies in front of Saturn and exclaims, 'Wheeeeee!'
